thread.title: Police: Man tried to rob NYPD officer at knifepoint
thread.title_full: Police: Man tried to rob NYPD officer at knifepoint - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Police: Man tried to rob NYPD officer at knifepoint
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - A man has been arrested after police say he allegedly tried to rob a uniformed New York City police officer at knifepoint.
The New York Police Department says Officer Daniel Mervis was standing on a Brooklyn subway platform shortly after 10:30 a.m. Saturday when the suspect approached him from behind.
Authorities say 24-year-old Joshua Muniz was holding a straight-edge razor when he came up behind Mervis and shouted, "Officer, open your pockets."
Police say the 6-year veteran officer turned around, pulled his gun and ordered Muniz to drop the razor.
They say Muniz continued coming toward the officer but eventually dropped the knife.
Muniz was arrested on attempted robbery and weapons possession charges.
It was not immediately clear whether he had an attorney who could comment on his behalf.
